subject: Works sanctioned & Bids invited by Regional Officers - Delegation of Power to Regional Officers to decide on COS and EOT- reg.
text: IRay 774y WTHNf gfeabrut (Tsq5 4Raev &k RTHN FAK4, HRG TaFR) National Highways Authority of India 77ta 74a (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) 0i-5 & 6, #4er-10, ERql; 75f faait 110 075 6-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 T/Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Delegation of Powers/2023 Policy Circular No.18.91/ 2023 dated 03rd November 2023 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/e CMD/Delegation/2023-24 (Comp. No. 226003)} Sub: Works sanctioned & Bids invited by Regional Officers Delegation of Power to Regional Officers to decide on COS and EOT reg: From time to time= Regional Officers have been delegated powers for sanction of works at their level   relating to rectification of blackspots identified by MoRTH, maintenance of highways, risk & cost works, etc (ref. enclosed details). Accordingly, ROs are sanctioning such works and inviting bids at their level. 2 _ It is, however, being observed that while estimates are being sanctioned by RO, the Change of Scope (COS) and Extension of Time (EOT) during execution are being referred to HQ for approval. The matter of sanction of COS in one of such works was discussed in EC meeting held o 01.02.2023 (Agenda Item 546.08) and EC decided to delegate powers to ROs for sanction of COS. 3 It has now been decided that COS and EOT for works sanctioned by ROs shall be examined and approved by ROs, subject to the following: (i) COS is within 2O% of Contract Price and COS is valued as per the principles followed in estimation of such works duly applying tender discount/ premium as provided in the contract agreement; (ii) Revised Cost of Work including COS and cost claims of Contractor, if any, is within 2O% of the Original Sanctioned Cost; (iv) Revised Cost shall remain within the sanctioned ceilings of powers delegated to ROs; While granting EOT, the principles given in Policy Circular No. 9.2.33/2020 dated 26.02.2020 (copy enclosed) shall be followed. cost claim on account of EOT shall be settled while granting EOT. ROs shall be solely responsible for EOT/ cost claims allowed; (vi) If the parties desire to settle the implications of EOT and/ or COS before Ld. Sole Conciliator, the same shall be handled and draft Settlement Agreement shall be approved by RO. Contd_2/ - 91 7 79 NHAI Any (-Piakod _
